channel.title: System Crash Monitors
channel.description: Anyone know of a good one? Or one that exists? I searched google, and the one I found was a prank. If there's one on Windows already I haven't found it.

item.title: System Crash Monitors
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Unhandled:

The crash dumps aren’t informative enough? If the windows kernel itself can’t tell you what the problem is then why would some external tool be able to?

All it says I can do is to remove a recently installed program, or recently updated program. It said that if I installed RAM recently it might be causing it. And I have, but I’ve had no problems until just the past 4 days. And I installed the RAM a month and a half ago. I’ll google the error number and find out anything about it.

Read full topic

item.title: System Crash Monitors
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:

The crash dumps aren’t informative enough? If the windows kernel itself can’t tell you what the problem is then why would some external tool be able to?

Read full topic

item.title: System Crash Monitors
item.dc:creator: @moparscape4lifez moparscape4lifez
item.description:
@moparscape4lifez wrote:

look inside your pc’s startup areas for any bat files added that go off every 50 mins that you might of gotten from infested privite server packs. Look in other places like runOnce runAlways in ‘regedit’ and ‘msconfig’ and finally in your Start -> All Programs -> Startup.

search every file on google to see if its part of windows or your ipod or something… and anything thats not just uninstall and if no uninstall delete it.

Windows it self doesn’t crash, it only crashes when its the users fault.

deleting hal.dll forces you to format your pc don’t listen to Pwnd you’ll get fucked over.

Read full topic

item.title: System Crash Monitors
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Just delete something…

Google shit that causes it,
And figure out why it’s caused.

Then write something simple,
And done!

delete hal.dll…

Read full topic

item.title: System Crash Monitors
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Like if I get a blue screen of death, or the computer has a serious error and shuts itself down, it will give me some information about it. I’ve looked at the data windows give me, but it doesn’t do anything for me. I want to figure out what exactly is causing my PC to crash every 10 minutes.

Read full topic
